format(java.util.List<? extends org.apac.Description: Returns a String that is suitable for use as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded list of parameters in an HTTP PUT or HTTP POST.
format(java.util.List<? extends org.apac.FullName: public static String format (List<? extends NameValuePair> parameters, String encoding)

Parameters: encoding to use while parsing the query
parse(java.net.URI, java.lang.String).Description: Returns a list of @B_org#apache#http#NameValuePair_E@ as built from the URI's query portion. For example, a URI of http://example.org/path/to/file?a=1&b=2&c=3 would return a list of three NameValuePairs, one for a=1, one for b=2, and one for c=3. This is typically useful while parsing an HTTP PUT.
parse(java.net.URI, java.lang.String).FullName: public static List<NameValuePair> parse (URI uri, String encoding)

isEncoded(org.apache.http.HttpEntity).Description: Returns true if the entity's Content-Type header is application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

Throws: If there was an exception getting the entity's data.
parse(org.apache.http.HttpEntity).Description: Returns a list of @B_org#apache#http#NameValuePair_E@ as parsed from an @B_org#apache#http#HttpEntity_E@. The encoding is taken from the entity's Content-Encoding header. This is typically used while parsing an HTTP POST.

Parameters: Input that contains the parameters to parse.
Encoding to use when decoding the parameters.
parse(java.util.List<org.apache.http.Nam.Description: Adds all parameters within the Scanner to the list of parameters, as encoded by encoding. For example, a scanner containing the string a=1&b=2&c=3 would add the @B_org#apache#http#NameValuePair_E@ a=1, b=2, and c=3 to the list of parameters.
parse(java.util.List<org.apache.http.Nam.FullName: public static void parse (List<NameValuePair> parameters, Scanner scanner, String encoding)
